intro: Ionoxalis trineuris, commonly known as the three-veined wood sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with three distinct veins, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. Native to regions of South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance.
